name: My Bones
description: It is a short but very interesting horror,about a man who woke up in his own grave,next to his family.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 x64 Processor: Intel Core 2 Quad Q8300 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce 9800 GT 1gb DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: Directx 9.0

reviews.review_text: At least at this stage the game is really not worth buying. While I believe the developer did a good job with music and atmosphere, the overall impression is very negative. While the fact that the game is very short (15-20 mins top) would be acceptable, the game lacks pretty much in everything. The english translation is terrible and in many places simply doesn't make any sense. The story, specially the endings, could have been better as well, as of now it looks incomplete and flawed. The coding needs polishing (for example, the character will comment things like 'that's my wife's tomb' both when entering and when exiting the crypt, breaking immersion) and there are plenty of graphic glitches and just incomplete/imperfect assets, the messages written on the walls look like bad photoshop result. Flashlight needs tweaking (in some places, if you turn it off, you will be in complete darkness, while if you turn it on you end up blinded) and an ingame tip to use it if needed (if I haven't checked the controls before starting the game, I wouldn't even have known you had a flashlight). Overall, skip it. This game still needs lots of work.

I just finished this game, and while I'm not a professional critic I am a critical consumer. Having said this I wanted to voice my opinion to aid anyone interested in this title. This game's style in terms of overall concept and creativity is quite good and unique. However I cannot recommend anyone to purchase it. 'My Bones' is incredibly short even for a narrative. I completed it with both alternate conclusions in sixteen minutes. There are many bugs, grammatical errors, and it feels like a student project. (And likely is.)   Again from an artistic stand point I can appreciate what the developer was trying to achieve, but this alone doesn't justify a price tag of any kind. This should be offered as a free experience for the casual and curious. I paid ninety nine cents for this download, and while this amount is inconsequential, it is unmerited.   -A short review, for a short title-

scariest part about the game is the grammar i swear, it sounds like it was written by a 6 year old in vietnam. check my play time. that's 2 full play throughs, first time exploring everything and giving it a chance, the second time a speed run just so i could see what the other ending was.  seriously, don't bother, really laggy, mildly 3spoopy5me sounds/music, no plot to speak of, no character development, no difficulty whatsoever, really linear. you can even technically make it through without using all the keys.  they keep mentioning some beast being on the loose, and if you look through its cage you can see a fuzzy picture of what appears to be a butchered pig for a second or less. much scared, so intrigued.  would be better if there was actually something to run from, or if the developer hired someone to proofread, seriously. how do you expect to have a story driven game that is just unreadable.  oh, and no trading cards.

You can say what you want about this game but it offers a lot of value when it comes to commas. Never,have,I ever,seen,so many, incorrectly,used,commas. At £2, there's probably a good comma/4p, which is a very high rate. I bought it in a bundle so I'm laughing all the way to the bank.  If you don't care about commas though, there's not much here. It has a decent atmosphere, although the sounds are very low quality. The graphics are circa early 2000. The game took me 10 minutes to complete, but some of it was a little rushed, with exploration probably another 5 minutes. The gramma (as slightly touched upon) and spelling is bad. The story is confusing, after walking around a graveyard, your transported to a few abstract scenes, which involve more walking.  Can recommend if you're into: High comma/value ratio. Like walking with heavily compressed sound and bad graphics. Want a 10 minute horror game about a dude who was dead but now is not dead but is still dead.  Can't recommend if you're into: Not spending money on short games. Like the horror genre. Have,a,strong distaste for,bad gramma,and spelling.

**sigh** more litter on the Steam horror tag. Visually the first place you find yourself in is pretty cool. After that it's a bunch of random nonsense with the minimum amount of story to push you along, and even that doesn't really make sense. There was clearly no proofreader on hand, or if so they were dumb as hell, because the few notes around were absolutely atrocious, they made my brain hurt.  This game amounts to nothing more than a key hunt. That's it. You can beat it in like five minutes with ease.

My girlfriend played this game and it is according to her 'creepy as ♥♥♥♥'. While I do agree with her regarding the scare-factor it is a game that is lacking in many things. Such as linguistics (spelling, capitalization), random FPS drops, and more. But for 0.5 euro (bought while discounted) I wouldn't expect anything more.  + Atmosphere + Story + Sound   - Movement - Language
